FuncDef:
The isis lfa-backup command enables an interface to participate in Loop-Free Alternate (LFA) calculation.
The undo isis lfa-backup command disables an interface from participating in LFA calculation.
By default, an IS-IS interface can participate in LFA calculation.
CLIs: undo isis lfa-backup [ level-1 | level-1-2 | level-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Adds an interface to a Level-1 area.
-

Adds an interface to a Level-1 and a Level-2 area.
-

Adds an interface to a Level-2 area.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, FRR calculates a backup link based on the LFA algorithm, and the backup link together with the active link is added to the forwarding table. If an error occurs on the network, FRR can fast switch traffic to the backup link before route convergence on the control plane. This feature ensures uninterrupted traffic forwarding and greatly improves the reliability of IS-IS networks.
By default, an IS-IS interface can participate in LFA calculation. However, some backup links are uncertain when an active link is faulty. To prevent traffic from being transmitted along a link, you can run the undo isis lfa-backup command on the interface on the link to disable the interface from participating in the LFA calculation.
Precautions
To ensure that FRR can function properly, do not disable all interfaces from participating in the LFA calculation.
